title: Lifecycle Actions
intro: A primary component of the Template Edition Platform is providing Members with clear actions that allow Templates to be edited, reviewed, submitted, rejected and eventually, published. In this section we will look at the interaction of Members and Lifecycle Tasks via Actions to facilitate this collaboration.

blocks.content: Lifecycle Actions are the way that users confirm that a certain Lifecycle stage has been completed. These actions can be given specific names when creating a Lifecycle for the Enterprise.
You must have administrative access to change anything to do with your Enterprise. Contact your Administrator to discuss naming of Actions or any other queries.

blocks.caption:
Confirm actions are identified as ticks.
These confirm that the current Task for this stage in the Lifecycle has been completed.

Reject actions are identified as crosses.
This action sends the Template back to a previous stage. An example would be a Template in review getting Rejected and sent back to the Edit stage for Authors to make changes before submitting again.

In the Enterprise administration panel, selecting a Lifecycle and a specific stage allows one to rename the 'Confirm' and 'Reject' actions for each stage depending on the nature and context of the Stage. Here for example, instead of Confirm the Administrator has renamed the action to Initiate.

blocks.content: 3.4.2.1. Submitting a Template to a Lifecycle

To review, Lifecycle Actions are the way that Members confirm within FieldLogs that a certain Lifecycle stage is complete. These actions can be given specific names when creating a Lifecycle for the Enterprise.
Before any of this can happen however, a Template needs to be submitted to a desired Lifecycle from the Template editor:

blocks.caption: Once a user is sure of submission, the Submission popup window allows the user to choose a Lifecycle and add any additional comments before submitting the Template. Once submitted, the Template will automatically move to the first stage in the Lifecycle and the relevant Roles will receive Tasks in the their Inboxes.

blocks.content: 3.4.2.2. Taking action on Templates in a Lifecycle

Once a Template reaches a given stage, all Members assigned a specific Role will receive a Task in their Inboxes. Tapping 'View' on the Task cell will open the Template in the Template Editor and display the relevant Actions depending on the Lifecycle stage. blocks.caption:
The Archive action is an action specially reserved for a designated Role (assigned at Lifecycle creation by an Administrator) that allows for the removal of a Template from a Lifecycle so that it cannot finish. The Template is not deleted in the case, but simply removed from the Lifecycle and will need to be submitted again.

Any Member who has the correct access rights can request for a Template to be archived which will send a Task that requires confirmation by the assigned Archiving Role.
